caption: Came here with my bf for a Friday wrap up dinner. We recently moved from Southern California, so finding a pizza spot in the neighborhood is a must. This place is an absolute gem! Food selection is colorful and delicious. The staff is accomodating and makes you feel welcomed. They know their food! P.S. the restaurant is BYOB. Perfect for date night.

Fabulous experience at this tiny pizza shop and Italian restaurant in Brooklyn. The owner greeted us, served us and cooked all of our meals. Low gluten pizza was excellent as were all of the entrees, cooked one by one in cast iron skillets and served in the skillets. I wish we had taken photos. We brought our own wine. I will definitely go here again next time I am in NYC.
So delicious! I had the pear pasta and the eggplant pizza. The people working were incredibly nice. The chef even came out to ask how everything was. Definitely a must! Try it, you won't regret it!

Incredible place. The owner who’s also the chef and the server is a great guy. He made the wrong order for us so we had to wait for 20 minutes and man none of those 20 minutes was boring thanks to him. Honestly, the man’s high on life. Come here if you want some good pizza and a good time.

My absolute favorite place in New York for a real Italian pizza! The owner and the staff work so hard and there is always a great, lively vibe. Also, the only pizza I have ever had that doesn’t make me feel sluggish and bloated after - such a light, crispy, delicious pizza! I don’t go anywhere else anymore - a must visit!

The food was absolutely amazing! I came with my family for the first time and it felt as though we were back in Rome, Italy! All of the food was made from scratch and was to die for. My experience was divine. I would go back again and again and again!

B-E-S-T pizza we have ever had outside of Italy!!! The dough is simply spectacular. Everything was excellent, fresh, home made and cooked to order! Freshly sliced mortadella with home made focaccia is to die for. Food that is worth traveling to!
Charming spot, brazilian music, high quality ingredients in the pizza --- you should definitely stop by and have a meal at Giuseppe's Dough Vale
My favorite place in Brooklyn. Giuseppe, the chef/owner is the absolute man. I drive from Commack every so often just to get there.

Dough Vale's pizza crust is perfection. It's chewy, tangy, pillowy and is crispy in all the right places. If you love Napoletana-style pizza (thinner crust, softer in the middle and a good amount of char), look no further. Seriously, look no further. I've lived in NYC for 5 years and this is the best pizza I've had (followed by Best Pizza). Both pizzas we ordered were delicious but the Tartufo was a revelation (asparagus, taleggio, walnuts AND truffle? Yes please). The pizza was also ready in minutes and you can watch it being made by the charming gentleman that owns the place. 10/10 would recommend!

10/10 great restaurant and amazing food. I had the pear pasta and the Ingredients were fresh and on point. The owner's a hard worker dedicated to providing the best quality food and service... Not to mention the vibes are superb. Highly recommend this local gem!
Amazing pizza and pasta
Delicious pizza 👌🏼

As a Brazilian/Italian living in Brooklyn for 5 years I can say that this is the Italian place you want to go!! The chef, food and atmosphere are amazing. My husband is an airline pilot and we go to Italy several times a year... this place is better places in Italy. Seriously, their food is out of this world! You will not be disappointed.
Go see Giuseppe. Authentic Italian pizza and a good dude.
Giuseppe is amazing and his pizza is better! Best one man show in any town
Best pizza in NYC. Owner Giuseppe is warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're in a restaurant in Southern Italy. Cannot say enough good things about Dough Vale.

TLDR: profiled as delivery service worker and, as such, was treated poorly. Once the staff realized (and I realized) what was going on, they were apologetic but honestly, treating a young Black person in a hoodie poorly based on your assumptions about their work doesn't shine well: delivery workers are risking their lives in a pandemic, so they deserve more respect and empathy. Offering a free dessert "the next time I come" doesn't quite cut it.  The kicker is that they hadn't even made my pizza when I arrived (tech mishap) - they actually gave me another order at first. Also, the pizza was frankly *just* okay. For the price  and the trouble, I should have gone elsewhere.

A wonderful experience.  One can truly taste the love with which Chef Giuseppe conjures his exquisitely delicious creations. The magical culinary art is matched only by the warm hospitality, which is graciously enhanced by the lovely waitress, Summer. Dough Vale is a truly rare gem.

Most enjoyable pizza East of the Mississippi. It’s the opposite of a Chicago deep dish (also delicious) with its light and crispy yet slightly malleable and substantial crust. The toppings are clean yet robust, flavorful, and balanced. Each pizza is hand made with passion and meticulous attention from when the baker prepares the dough days before to when he takes it from the oven, embellishes it, and places it in front of you. The secret is that only way to experience the real effect of this pizza is to have it at the shop with the cheerful Italian who does everything himself from open to close. But it’s okay if you’d rather order delivery, because I need to take your seat.
Best dinning experience in a long time!
Quality food that oozes with passion. Family owned, fresh ingredients, everything cooked on the spot. Will become a regular!
I've liked everything I've tried, but the Parma is my favorite. Giuseppe is passionate about the quality of his pizzas (esp. the dough) and his hospitality. This place is a gem.

One of the most wonderful restaurants in New York City. The food, the service, and the atmosphere all somehow simultaneously outdo one another. The gnocchi and the pizza are exceptional. Do yourself a favor and enjoy a meal here.
Divine Pizza, fresh ingridients, light and crispy dough, warm and welcoming service. What else can you ask for!?? Grazi!
The best pizza made by the nicest guy of the city

It’s the kind of place you wished you knew before everyone else knew about it. Food is out of this world. Even to Italian standards. Giuseppe (the owner) Lives and breathes his food. And it shows. Everything feels homely and authentic. You’re getting sold outstanding food, and it does not disappoint. 100/100
We’ve been here twice now and loved the food both times, and the owner is incredibly friendly!
Incredibly delicious pizza at a great price! The dough tastes fantastic and is cooked to perfection! This makes me feel at home, when home is far away! Way to go guys! I will be back soon!
Fantastic! I eat here all the time. Best pizza in the neighborhood.
This pizza is simply AMAZING. It’s a piece of happiness. Very friendly staff, cozy restaurants.
Good service and real excellent pizza made with love, also with good  quality ingredients , bursting with authentic flavors.
Delicious wood fired pizza, romantic interiors, excellent service. A must-try!
First review. Worth it for a Sicilian. Outstanding pizza - the Valentina, outstanding hospitality. Grazie mille, Giuseppe
Best and most authentic Italian spot of Brooklyn, Giuseppe is awesome! Great outside seating with the best food. Don't forget to bring your own wine...!

I had my first Dough Vale pizza tonight and am already planning how soon I can have another. The pizza was the most delicious authentic Neapolitan pizza I have ever had in NYC. I had the Margherita - the true test of a pizzeria. The dough was pulled paper-thin except on the edges where it was perfectly puffed and blistered. The homemade sauce, cheese and fresh basil leaves combined with the crust to make every bite a delight. This is a tiny shop where everything is home made and the owner is so friendly. Try it! You’ll love it!

Amazing authentic Italian cuisine! Great service and so genuine. We enjoyed The Parma pizza, which was thin and crispy with a soft tender dough. Very well priced. The Ricoletta salad was a refreshing accompaniment to our meal. Will be going back to this local gem.
Best pizza I’ve had in Williamsburg by far.  I wish I could eat more.  EDIT: I managed to eat more. Finish a whole pie by myself.
They made us a really nice customized vegan pizza. I was impressed

This is hands down... the best Italian food I have ever had, and I have been to Italy. The owner Giuseppe is so friendly and kind. We got the Valentina pizza and the prosciutto and burrata appetizer, and he gave us two cannoli on the house. Portions were generous and the food was EXCELLENT. I cannot recommend this place enough. We got takeout because of social distancing restrictions but the restaurant itself has a great atmosphere, warm and personal. We will absolutely be back!
The real deal! Mom and pop Italian pizza shop! This is that place you’ve been looking for

Being an asian and a dancer, which means I am extra cautious on calories, I had never ordered a pizza voluntarily in my life....until I bumped into Dough Vale one late night. Transferring a non-pizza person to someone ordering one DV pizza weekly, is the power of Dough Vale, and also represents how sweet and great the owners are. My favorites pizza is the special sausage pizza and you will NOT go wrong with the order. Give it try and you will be glad. 💕💕💕

What a beautiful and unexpected surprise! Originally from Palermo, owner Giuseppe and his beautiful Brazilian wife Leya have created something really special. This place has amazing burrata and a delicious selection of thin crust pizzas made from custom three flour blend pizza dough. BYOB was a nice touch too. Look out for the handsome young hardworking co-chef, Carlos, in the den with maestro Giuseppe; he's got the best teacher in town! My girlfriend and I LOVE this place and had a blast chatting with this sweet couple during our late night bite. We recommend this place to everyone. You won't be disappointed!
A family owned restaurant that makes you feel like you’re in Italy. Hospitable and kind owners and the food is delicious and the pizza is cooked to perfection. The pastas are just as good!

Such a little slice of heaven in a part of town you don’t normally go.. But you should, the owner is very kind, and passionate about his work. The food, pizza, pasta and everything I’ve tried in the three times I’ve come have been impressed. Btw it’s BYOB so bring a nice bottle and have a meal that makes you happy and rich (because it’s not breaking the bank).
Best pizza in Brooklyn. Period! (the pasta is INCREDIBLE too)
Amazing Pizza -BYOB (just spend $15/person) - and the Cannoli were top notch
Amazing!

Cozy and warm environment, with a nice menu everything is made from TOP QUALITY INGREDIENTS!! The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. I was taken here by a friend and will be sharing this experience with others. I will be back but hope you guys make the effort to try out thus little gem!💎

(Translated by Google) The pizza is delicious. Be careful that they charge you $ 5 per person per bottle of wine you open. Its alot!  (Original) La pizza es rica. Cuidado que te cobran 5 dólares por persona por botella de vino que abras. Es mucho!

There's so many nice things I can say about this place. It's up there with the best of the best pizza in NYC. They also have other dishes well worth trying & it's BYOB! It's run by a husband & wife who are welcoming, good people & the owner/chef is Italian! It's a quaint restaurant that's great for dates and groups. You'll be glad you tried it. Oh and to-go food is not packed in plastic :)

Giuseppe sets a masterful table and welcomes you into an amazing slice of New York that’s hard to find these days. He and his wife have made a place that feels like you’re having an amazing meal in your best friend’s kitchen.  I had the Funghetti, which I can’t recommend highly enough, but because it was so delicious— I missed getting a photo of that so you’ll have to settle for this incredibly delicious house-made cannoli.  Of all the secret surprises I’ve found in this city, Dough Vale surpasses them in every way.
Amazing, Cozy, and Delicious!
Excellent appetizer and pizza 1.30.20
Best pizza in Brooklyn! Amazing service too, always feelike your with family.

The menu is phenomenal. My girlfriend invited me here for Sunday brunch and it was so good, I was literally back the following evening for a dinner date. The fusion of Italian and Brazilian cuisine is ingenious. The owners are a very sweet couple who are hospitable and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Dough Vale for a great evening brunch or an intimate romantic dinner.

(Translated by Google) Extraordinary Ristorante with a special charm. Authentic Italian with American touches. family friendly atmosphere. highly recommended  (Original) Extraordinario Ristorante con un encanto especial. Auténtica comida Italiana con toques americanos. Ambiente familiar y amable. Muy recomendable
Pizza is phenomenal and the owners a joy
The best pizza ever. Valentina and Dough Vale NYC pizzas. The owners are super friendly and accommodating. It was like eating dinner with family. Terrific BYOB.

Excellent everything: quality ingredients, passion, and attention to detail made for the best pizza crust I've ever had! Highly recommend the Piccante pizza. Caprese app came out fast to occupy our 4yo. You could taste the quality of the olive oil! That passion and detail are evident in the ambiance as well. Cosy, simple, authentic, family. The Southside is beyond fortunate to have this little gem. This should be your neighborhood go-to spot. And if it's out of your way, it's a worthwhile destination.

I came to New York with my family to spend the New Year’s and a book the last dinner of 2019 at an Italian restaurant that I read wonders about. Dinner exceeded all our expectations, the place it’s small but very cozy, the food is divine and the owners Giuseppi and his wife are very kind. Plus, the soundtrack was MPB   Couldn't think of a better way to spend the last night of 2019. Can’t say enough good things about this place. We will be back!
Really nice , good pizza selections

Walking into Dough Vale feels like walking into an intimate dinner party rather than a restaurant. It’s a small, cozy place where you feel like you’re at the owner’s home and he’s cooking just for you. The pizza is amazing and the owner is great for conversation. Plus it’s BYOB. Can’t say enough good things about this place. We will be back!

I was born and raised in NYC, and Dough Vale is one of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to. It feels like a true labor of love by the couple who owns it. They are incredibly warm and want to make you feel at home in their cozy space they built themselves. The husband is a chef from a small town in Italy and makes all your food himself. He takes incredible care with each dish, and everyone has fresh, high quality ingredients he bought himself. The prices are much lower than most upscale Italian restaurants and they want the food to be fair and affordable for their customers. Dough Vale makes you feel like you’re in a small, community oriented town where you’re cared for rather than the way NYC can often feel huge and impersonal. I can’t recommend it enough!
You can taste the passion and love in the food. Giuseppe is a wonderful host, chef, and owner and really cares about giving you 110% in both food quality, taste, service, and feeling at home.

1) by far the best pizza my friends and I have ever eaten, along with everything else on the menu (the cast iron ravioli is amazing)  2) Giuseppi and Leah are awesome people and going there feels like getting dinner with your Italian relatives (even if you're not Italian)  3) go here now, don't look at anywhere else.  This place is so good that I'm tempted not to write this review so I can keep the lines short and keep getting in - 10 times in a few months already, but Giuseppi and Leah are too endearing and the food is far too good for that.  Be patient, as each pizza is made with love. You won't regret it.
Amazing food, BYOB, I had burratta with prosciutto, bread for it was baked in front of me!
Great authentic Italian pizza, staff was extremely friendly and the atmosphere was great especially while eating dinner. Highly recommend this restaurant.

This is not just a pizza spot, this is a great experience with delicious pizza. It might seem expensive but I can say it’s well worth it. The owner is a great host and pizza artist. As grandma would say, he puts love into his food creations. Guarantee to enjoy it.

I simply cannot recommend this place enough. The atmosphere, the menu, the quality of the ingredients, all the way to the couple that run the place, it is an incredible culinary and social experience. I watched as Giuseppe made the bread for my starter right in front of my eyes and then cut the prosciutto fresh. Such a treat.
Food great.....

Great pizza spot! The owner is friendly and explained to us that the dough takes 3 days to make and is high protein and low gluten. I can confirm, it's also very delicious! I highly recommend. I believe the owner also built the place out over a period of 7 months, definitely a labor of love here. 😊

would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could. DV is an intimate, family owned restaurant with a wonderfully personable owner/chef. restaurant is named after his daughter, "Valentina." If you're lucky, she might visit your table while you're dining. We had great conversation with this family when we were visiting. A must try if you're looking for tasty pizza spot.
Great restaurant, owned and operated by a lovely couple who love interacting with the customers. Would recommend the mushroom ravioli.

The owner, Guiseppe, welcomed us into his restaurant and made us feel like we were dining in his own home. The pizzas had a crispy, pillowy crust to them and are highly recommended. Top-notch service, ambience, and food. Can’t wait to go back!
The owner Giuseppe is an absolute legend. This place rules.
!!!!!! Excellent !!!!!!!! Cute, quiet, and delicious !

I cannot rave about this place enough. Everything is so fresh and delicious. It has a great atmosphere that makes you feel very at home.  I had the tomato salad which was amazing and so light, along with the Parma pizza which was also SO GOOD. The ravioli looked incredible along with everything else that came out of the kitchen. If you sit at the bar you can watch everything as it’s prepared 😋  BYOB at the moment as they work on getting their alcohol license (they have glasses and bottle openers etc).  Just so great.
Relaxed ambience and run by really lovely people. The passion and care they put into the place shines through. Pizza Buratta was delicious. Highly recommend
The best pizza in Willamsburg and maybe Brooklyn. A must-try.
Highly recommended pizza experience. Quality ingredients, quality food. Best neighborhood restaurant for sure.
Randomly stopped into this place. Sick atmosphere, incredible pizza and a really nice owner. Can’t  recommend enough.
Wonderful experience

Amazing place! Great atmosphere! Great food! We ordered pizza Valentina, pasta with mushrooms and prosciutto and burrata! I do not have a picture of appetizer we ate it to fast 🥰 they trying to get their liquor licence so it BYOB for now!
Pizza is delicious!! Love the vibe and the ppl here.  Highly recommend!
Best pizza I ever had
Great pizza place! The owner who happens to be a chef as well makes sure you’re served with delicious food! Highly recommend
Best pizza I've eaten in NYC
Great experience! The owner is very nice and the food is simply phenomenal! Great ambience, will definitely come back.
I always go to my friends house next to this place - so I went and got him a pizza.  Man !!!!! 🤤 was so good.  I’d recommend this place to my friends.
Lovely service, excellent food!

If you are ever in Williamsburg this is a great place to have a great pie of pizza. The owners were welcoming and the bufala pizza was crispy and delicious. I would highly recommend anyone in the area to give them a try.
